summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons press release announcing the death of inmate Jeffrey Edward Epstein on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. He was found unresponsive in his cell from an apparent suicide and was later pronounced dead at a hospital. The FBI is investigating the incident.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center from an apparent suicide. He was indicted for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

events.title: Epstein found unresponsive in cell
events.description: Jeffrey Edward Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at approximately 6:30 a.m. at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. Life-saving measures were initiated, and he was transported to a local hospital where he was pronounced dead.

events.title: Epstein arrives at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Edward Epstein arrived at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York under pretrial status after being indicted for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Edward Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York on August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:30 a.m.
He was pronounced dead at a local hospital after life-saving measures failed.
The FBI is investigating the incident, which is described as an 'apparent suicide'.
Epstein arrived at the facility on July 6, 2019, under pretrial status after being indicted for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.
The Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York is an Administrative security facility housing 763 male offenders at the time.
